summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing the Victim Notification System (VNS) for the Epstein case (31E-MM-108062). The emails coordinate efforts to ensure all identified victims are properly registered in VNS, referencing a 'Miami list' and a 'Total Victim list', and involve cross-checking between different FBI offices.

persons.name: Mas
persons.context: Mentioned as having 'worked her magic' with victims in the context of the Victim Notification System (VNS) for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Sage
persons.context: An intern mentioned in the email chain, likely involved in the victim notification coordination efforts for the Epstein case.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel (specialist and intern) working on victim notification for the same case.

events.title: Coordination of Epstein Victim Lists
events.description: FBI personnel from different offices (NY, CID, DO) exchange emails to coordinate the entry of identified Epstein victims into the Victim Notification System (VNS), referencing a 'Miami list' and a 'Total Victim list'.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain regarding victim notification for the Epstein case (31E-MM-108062).
It references a Victim Notification System (VNS) used to track victims throughout the legal process, tied to FBI, USAO, BOP, USPIS, and Marshals.
The emails discuss cross-checking a 'Miami list' of victims with the VNS list to ensure all are properly registered.
The correspondence highlights inter-office coordination (NY, CID, DO) within the FBI on victim services for the case.
The document contains a standard FBI confidentiality notice regarding the protection of Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
